item.title: Singapore and Kazakhstan are working together to enhance their bilateral trade relationship
item.description: Singapore and Kazakhstan have signed a bilateral investment treaty designed to encourage greater investment between the two nations. This agreement is intended to safeguard investors from both Singapore and Kazakhstan, giving them more confidence to pursue investment opportunities in each other’s countries. The treaty ensures that Singaporean companies operating in Kazakhstan will have additional protection for their investments beyond what is provided by Kazakhstan’s domestic laws, and the same applies to Kazakh companies in Singapore.
